com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview

Interface SmartGraphVertex<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type stored in the underlying vertex
    All Superinterfaces:
    SmartStylableNode
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SmartGraphVertexNode

    public interface SmartGraphVertex<V>
extends SmartStylableNode
    Abstracts the internal representation and behavior of a visualized graph vertex.
    See Also:
    SmartGraphPanel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getPositionCenterX()
      Return the center x-coordinate of this vertex in panel coordinates.
      double getPositionCenterY()
      Return the center y-coordinate of this vertex in panel coordinates.
      double getRadius()
      Returns the circle radius used to represent this vertex.
      Vertex<V> getUnderlyingVertex()
      Returns the underlying (stored reference) graph vertex.
      void setPosition(double x, double y)
      Sets the position of this vertex in panel coordinates.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.brunomnsilva.smartgraph.graphview.SmartStylableNode

        setStyle, setStyleClass

    • Method Detail

      • getUnderlyingVertex

        Vertex<V> getUnderlyingVertex()
        Returns the underlying (stored reference) graph vertex.
        Returns:
        vertex reference
        See Also:
        Graph

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(double x,
                 double y)
        Sets the position of this vertex in panel coordinates. Apart from its usage in the SmartGraphPanel, this method should only be called when implementing SmartPlacementStrategy.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate for the vertex
        y - y-coordinate for the vertex

        Return the center x-coordinate of this vertex in panel coordinates.
        Returns:
        x-coordinate of the vertex

        Return the center y-coordinate of this vertex in panel coordinates.
        Returns:
        y-coordinate of the vertex

      • getRadius

        double getRadius()

        circle radius
